meanings.def: action taken to improve or help a situation
examples: calls for government intervention to save the steel industry
intervention in something In the second group of states, direct intervention in the economy was limited.

meanings.def: action by a country to become involved in the affairs of another country when they have not been asked to do so
examples: intervention in something NATO intervention in the troubled region

meanings.def: action taken to improve a medical condition or illness
examples: Most patients make a recovery without further intervention.

meanings.def: the act of interrupting somebody when they are speaking in order to say something
examples: People resented his repeated interventions in the debate.

meanings.def: an occasion when a group of people meet to take action with a friend or family member who has an addiction to drugs or alcohol, in order to help them recover
examples: Family intervention is an essential component of treatment for adolescent drug abuse.
